thing-type.label: ZTM230 Dual paddle wall mounted transmitter
thing-type.description: Dual paddle wall mounted transmitter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 Wall Mounted Transmitter is a component of the HomePro lighting control system. Wire the Transmitter anywhere power is available according to the diagram above and program from the Wireless Controller to operate loads. Inclusion of the ZTM230 Wall Mounted Transmitter on the ZTH200 Wireless Controller menu allows remote ON/OFF control and dimming of lights controlled by associated modules, as it does not control any electrical load directly.</p&gt <p&gtThis Wall Mounted Transmitter is designed to work with other Z-Wave enabled devices. Z-Wave nodes of other types can be Included in the network and will also act as repeaters to increase the range of the network. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtIncluding to the Network (Must be installed in its permanent location, not on test bench)</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSetup the controller you are using to include the device into the network.</li&gt <li&gtTap the top or bottom of the left switch once <br /&gt<br /&gt</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSetup the controller you are using to exclude a device from the network.</li&gt <li&gtTap the top or the bottom of the left switch once. </li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Ignore Transmitting Start Level Bit
parameter.description: Set Ignore Start Level Bit When Transmitting Dim Commands<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 can send Dim commands to Z-Wave enabled dimmers. The Dim command has a start level embedded in it. A dimmer receiving this command will start dimming from that start level. However, the command can be sent so that the dimmer ignores the start level and instead start dimming from its current level. By default, the ZTM230 sends the command so that the dimmer will start dimming from its current dim level rather then the start level embedded in the command. To change this, simply set the configuration parameter above to 0. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Suspend Group 4
parameter.description: Disable transmitting commands to group 4 devices.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtYou may wish to disable transmitting commands to Z-Wave devices that are in Group 4 without “disassociating” those devices from the group.<br /&gtSetting parameter 2 to the value of 1 will stop the ZTM230 from transmitting to devices that are “associated” into Group 4 </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Night Light
parameter.description: LED behaviour of the ZTM230.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe LED on the ZTM230, will by default, turn ON when the status of the devices in Group 1 is ON. To make the LED turn ON when the status of Group 1 is OFF set this parameter to a value of 1. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Invert Switch
parameter.description: Switch paddle behaviour<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTo change the top of the transmitter to OFF and the bottom of the transmitter to ON, set parameter 4 to 1. To change back to original settings, set this parameter to the value of 0. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Ignore Receiving Start Level Bit
parameter.description: Ignore Start Level When Receiving Dim Commands<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 can send Dim commands to Z-Wave enabled dimmers. The Dim command has a start level embedded in it. A dimmer receiving this command will start dimming from that start level. However, the command can be sent so that the dimmer ignores the start level and instead start dimming from its current level. By default, the ZTM230 sends the command so that the dimmer will start dimming from its current dim level rather then the start level embedded in the command. To change this, simply set the configuration parameter above to 0</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNote that this only affects a level that is reported or possibly sent by the ZTM230 since the ZTM230 does not control a load.</strong&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: On/Off Command dim step
parameter.description: Dim step parameter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDim step (dim rate) parameter. It can be set to a value of 1 to 99. This value indicates how many levels the dimmer will change when the timer (discussed below) expires.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: On/Off Command dim timer
parameter.description: Dim timer parameter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDim timer parameter (how fast the dim rate) parameter. It can be set to a value of 1 to 255. This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then the dim level will change every 10mS. If you set it to 255, then the dim level will change every 2.55 seconds. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Local Control dim rate
parameter.description: Dim step Parameter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtLocal Control dim rate. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Dim timer Parameter
parameter.description: Dim timer Parameter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDim timer Parameter. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: ALL ON/ALL OFF dim step
parameter.description: ALL ON/ALL OFF dim step<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtALL ON/ALL OFF dim rate step parameter. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: ALL ON/ALL OFF dim rate
parameter.description: Dim timer Parameter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtALL ON/ALL OFF dim rate timer Parameter.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Disable group 4 during dim command
parameter.description: Disable group 4 during dim command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtNote that this only affects a level that is reported or possibly sent by the ZTM230 since the ZTM230 does not control a load.<br /&gt<br /&gtAfter the ZTM230 is commanded to stop dimming when it has been dimming because of the DIM START command, it will then command the Z-Wave devices that are in Group 4 to its new level. To prevent the ZTM230 from commanding the Z-Wave devices in Group 4 during this particular occurrence, set Parameter 13 to the value of 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Enable shade control group 2
parameter.description: Enable shade control group 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 can control shade control devices via its group 2 if this configuration parameter is set to 1. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Enable shade control group 3
parameter.description: Enable shade control group 3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 can control shade control devices via its group 3 if this configuration parameter is set to 1. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Enable shade control group 1
parameter.description: Enable shade control group 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 can control shade control devices via its group 1 if this configuration parameter is set to 1. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Transmission LED
parameter.description: Transmission LED behaviour<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 will flicker its LED when it is transmitting to any of its 4 groups. This flickering can be set to not flicker at all (set to 0), to flicker the entire time it is transmitting (set to 1), or to flicker for only 1 second when it begins transmitting (set to 2). By default, the ZTM230 is set to flicker for only 1 second.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Poll group 1 interval
parameter.description: Group 1 poll interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtHow often it will poll Group 1 is configured using this parameter 20. The default poll rate is 2. Note that the poll interval starts timing again upon successful transmission of the poll request. Also note that the polling interval is not “exact” and that you may see some slight drift occur. Also the poll interval is reset upon switch being pressed. In addition, on power up, the ZTM230 will randomly poll based upon it’s node ID within 2 minutes of power being applied. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Poll group 1
parameter.description: Poll group 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 will poll the first node in Group 1 in order to keep itself synchronized with the group if this configuration parameter is set to 1. How often it will poll is configured using parameter 20. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Poll Group 2
parameter.description: Poll Group 2 interval (minutes).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe ZTM230 will poll the first node in Group 2 in order to keep itself synchronized with the group if this configuration parameter is set to 1. How often it will poll is configured using parameter 20. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Group 1
parameter.description: Group 1 left paddle<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtNodes in this group are turned ON and OFF by tapping the top or bottom of the left switch.<br /&gtNodes associated into this group are dimmed by pressing and holding the bottom of the left switch until the desired dim level is reached. </p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Group 2
parameter.description: Group 2 right paddle<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtNodes in this group are turned ON and OFF by tapping the right switch.<br /&gtNodes associated into this group are dimmed by pressing and holding the bottom of the right switch until the desired dim level is reached. The LED on the right switch will indicate the status of group 2. Group 2 will be polled at a specific interval and the status of group 2 will be indicated via the LED. The polling interval can be configured.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Group 3
parameter.description: Group 3 double tap right paddle<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtNodes in this group are turned ON and OFF by tapping the right switch twice. Nodes associated into this group are dimmed by tapping the bottom of the switch once and then pressing and holding the bottom of the switch until the desired dim level is reached.<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtnote that associating nodes into group 3 will cause a very slight delay before the command is transmitted to group 2. </p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Group 4
parameter.description: Group 4<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtNodes in this group are turned ON or OFF or set to a specific dim level when the ZTM230 is controlled remotely. You can place up to 5 nodes in each group.<br /&gtIf controlling dimmers, for best results, associate the dimmers into the group first. </p&gt
